article: 12 Ways to Make Him Miss You Like Crazy over Text (with Examples)
intro: Do you wonder if your man is thinking of you when you’re not together? Whether you’re

steps.title: Guys love hearing what you like about them.
steps.subtitle: A quick  will put a smile on his face and make him think about how good you make him feel. You could mention how he looks, how he handles a situation, or how you feel about him. Just try to stay away from heavy-handed compliments if you don’t mean them though; guys can see right through them.
sub-points: “You always know just what to say to make me feel better 😊”
“I bet you’re looking really handsome today 😘 just like every day!”
“Have I told you how amazing you are lately? Because you’re the most amazing guy I’ve met!”

points.name: Thank him for something he’s done.

steps.title: Showing your appreciation lets him know how much you care.
steps.subtitle: If your crush or boyfriend did something really nice for you, don’t let it go unnoticed. Even if it was just something small, he’ll love that you noticed what he’s doing and he’ll want to text you more.
sub-points: “Thank you so much for the text last night ❤️ it meant the world reading it this morning!”
“I really appreciated you coming over today. It was so nice seeing you again 🥰”
“Thank you for being so supportive of my dreams! You make me feel so special!”

steps.title: He’ll want to jump in and help out as much as he can.
steps.subtitle: You can ask him for a recommendation, life advice, or anything else that you need help with. Asking him for his thoughts lets him know that you trust him and his opinion, so he’ll want to  with you.
sub-points: “I’m making a playlist for us 🥰 What songs do you think I should include?”
“I really want to get a new computer, but I have no idea what I need. Do you have any recommendations?”
“I’ve wanted to get back into reading this year! What are some of your favorite books that you’d think I’d like?”

points.name: Remind him of your memories together.

steps.title: Reminiscing makes him think about the good times you’ve shared.
steps.subtitle: If you’re scrolling through your pics or just see something that makes you think of your crush or boyfriend, let him know! If you tell him about a good memory you’ve had together, he’ll remember it too and try to chase that feeling again.
sub-points: “I just heard the song we danced to on our first date. That night was so much fun 😘”
“I was scrolling through some old pics and found some cute ones from our vacation. I miss relaxing on the beach with you!”
“I just got dinner from that spot where you surprised me for our anniversary. I was thinking about you the entire time I was eating.”

points.name: Mention how much you miss him.

steps.title: Saying you miss him will make him think about  too.
steps.subtitle: If you’re thinking of him, don’t be afraid to send him a quick reminder! Let him know how you’re feeling and what you wish you could be doing together. When your crush or S.O. sees that you’re really missing him, he’ll want to spend time with you even more since you’re on his mind.
sub-points: “Just wanted to let you know I’ve been thinking of you a lot today ❤️”
“I know it’s only been a day since I saw you, but doesn’t it feel like foreverrrr.”
“I wish I could cuddle up with you right now!”

steps.title: Show him what he’s missing out on so he wants you more.
steps.subtitle: of whatever you’re doing and send it his way to show off what you’re up to. Follow up with a quick caption or question so he has something more to respond to. He’ll see that you’re having a good time without him and he’ll really want to be a part of it.
sub-points: Send a cute selfie and say, “Private fashion show just for you! How do I look?”
Snap a pic of the sunset and text, “Isn’t this gorgeous? Wish you could be here with me!”
Send an old picture of you and him together and say, “Aw, look at this pic I found of us! Aren’t we so cute? 🥰”

points.name: Set up a time to get together.

steps.title: He’ll get really excited  you’ve planned.
steps.subtitle: Planning when to see each other builds up his anticipation so he’ll miss you even more until your date. Throw out a fun suggestion of something to do when you hang out and spend time with one another. Show him how eager you are too so your crush or boyfriend knows you’re missing him.
sub-points: “I’m so excited to see you again! When are you free later this week?”
“I’d love to get dinner with you this weekend 🥰 Does Saturday night work?”
“You. Me. Bowling. This Wednesday. Think you can beat me? 😉”

points.name: Turn him on with a sexy message.

steps.title: You’re bound to get his attention with a .
steps.subtitle: Don’t be afraid to tell him what you want to do when you’re alone with him or send him a sexy selfie to really grab his attention. Leave a little up to the imagination; it’s sure to make him want you even more. He’ll be so excited to see you, he’ll be counting down the minutes until you can get together again.
sub-points: “Just imagine what we’d be doing if we were together right now 😘”
“🥵 I’m getting turned on just thinking about you!”
“Tell me what you want me to do to you 😉”

steps.title: Sending a message  makes him think of you all night long.
steps.subtitle: After a long day, a guy will really love seeing that he’s the last person you text before falling asleep. Flirt a little bit and tell him how much you miss him so he wishes he could cuddle up right next to you.
sub-points: “Goodnight 😚 I’ll see you in my dreams!”
“I don’t know how I’ll be able to sleep with you on my mind.”
“I wish I could fall asleep in your arms tonight ❤️”

steps.title: Guys are more likely to respond to lighthearted texts.
steps.subtitle: When you complain or talk about topics that bring the mood down, he might reply less. Talk about the things he likes to do, make him laugh, and use emojis to make your texts sound more fun so he keeps chatting.
sub-points: If you need to have a serious conversation, do it in person instead.

We asked 321 wikiHow readers about the best ways to build a connection with someone they like over text, and only  of people recommended bringing up super .  Instead, keep it light, fun, friendly, and sweet—save the heavy topics for in-person conversation!
